text: Cheung Sai Ho (27 August 1975 – 22 April 2011GoalGoalGoal – 蔣世豪-安息吧! (Chinese)) was a former Hong Kong professional football player. In the 1993 Gothia Cup, at the age of 18, Cheung Sai Ho scored the then fastest ever goal on record (2.8 seconds). He played his last game for Hong Kong during the 2010 FIFA World Cup qualification in 2007, where he helped Hong Kong to defeat East Timor 2–3 away and 8–1 at home to advance to the next round. He officially announced his retirement from professional football in July 2008.Ming Pao News, 開賽3秒入波 曾創世界紀錄 ==Death== On 22 April 2011, Cheung Sai Ho committed suicide at the age of 35 by jumping from his home in Tin Heng Estate. The police reported that he was having a dispute with his wife over money and love before the incident.Sing Tao News, 蔣世豪墮樓亡隊友感震驚 (From Yahoo!
